entry.title: Re: 交货单&发票打印-自定义合作伙伴地址
entry.content:
Hello @Joey3 

您遇到的问题是：打印送货单或发票时，数据源不会自动包含您定义的自定义交易伙伴功能。
根据SAP说明：
• 输出表单仅获取标准交易伙伴功能。但您可扩展表单数据源以添加交易伙伴功能，此操作将使打印程序能够检索并向表单传递供应商地址。
• 请检查公共云中是否为交货或计费对象提供了用于输出参数确定的BAdI
• 或可通过交易伙伴确定功能将供应商设为供应商交易伙伴功能，使其出现在标准交易伙伴表中
• 获取交易伙伴数据后，调整Adobe表单或Smartform以选择ZS交易伙伴，并在所需区域打印供应商地址
更多信息请参阅《打印交货单与供应商发票指南》。

Printing Delivery Notes & Print Supplier Invoices
希望以上说明能满足您的需求。如有其他疑问，欢迎随时垂询。
此致
敬礼
Chris

entry.title: Re: S4 Public Cloud 0L vs 4G configuration
entry.content:
Hello @JuliaLu 

Consider the following links for that scenario

Foreign Currency Valuation

Advanced Valuation in Financial Accounting

Here are some additions to the customers request/question.

OL is the leading ledger in S/4HANA Cloud. That means all valuations, postings and reporting rely on it. Only on leading ledger is allowed in Public Cloud.

Ledger 4G is the opposite to OL. This means, it is sometimes activated by implementation partners for parallel accounting. This could be for IFRS vs. Local GAAP but is typically used for universal parallel accounting scenarios.

While classic foreign currency valuation is available in some legacy scenarios, for public clouds SAP recommends and delivers the Advanced Foreign Currency Valuation. Once this is activated in a tenant, configurations and posting will be harmonised across ledgers.

So, no you cannot use OL for classic FX and 4G Advanced FX valuation. Considering Foreign currency valuation is a global process, SAP does not allow you split the ledgers.

If the partner has activated 4G then the Advanced FX Valuation is the standard approach to be applied. One consistent FX valuation across all ledgers is the only supported configuration.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Business Partner Replication from S/4HANA Public Clou...
entry.content:
Hello @FlorisBoon 

Thank you for your question.

Regarding your questions, here are a few facts:

  1. There is no official SAP Note or standard fix that automatically includes the General BP role in DRF payload from S/4HANA Public Cloud. Considering it is a technical role in the backend, it is not released in any API config.
  2. As a workaround on the EWM side, it is possible to implement a BAdI (such as /SCWM/EX_BUPA_INBOUND). This should add the General Role to all incoming Business Partners. This also enriches the payload after receipt and thereby allowing EWM to process the BP correctly even if the General role is missing in the message from S/4
    • If you prefer a custom solution to enhance on the cloud side, note that extension option is limited due to SaaS restrictions.
  3. The scenario you mentioned is not fully covered out-of-the-box for public cloud to decentralized EWM. Custom logic is needed.

I recommend keeping the S/4HANA best practice. You can manage your requirement in EWM.

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Accelerating GxP Compliance for SAP Digital Manufacuring in the Public Cloud
entry.content:
The life sciences industry is rapidly adopting SAP’s public cloud offerings. According to McKinsey, over 80% of the top 30 global pharmaceutical and MedTech companies have adopted cloud solutions across various parts of their operations. Key drivers include lower cost of ownership, scalability, and rapid innovation. Another major influence is the advent of AI and Gen-AI, which McKinsey estimates could unlock $60b - $110b a year in economic value for the industry. However, organizations can only leverage Gen-AI at scale if they operate in the cloud. This adoption also come with a key challenge: How can organizations demonstrate GxP compliance in public clouds, when many controls are managed by SAP?

This article explores the adoption journey for public cloud products, using SAP Digital Manufacturing as an example.

Discover and Prepare

Product assessment for Cloud controls

Traditional on-premises compliance strategies were built around physical infrastructures and static environments. In a modern automated public cloud environment, compliance requirements need adaptation. For example:

  1. Backup and Recovery – Life sciences organizations must meet regulatory requirements for backup, including regular snapshots and defined retention schedules. Traditionally, this meant storing daily, weekly, and monthly backups for extended periods. With microservice based environments, older backups lose relevance with every update, limiting restoration usefulness. Organizations should rather adopt a risk-based approach—aligning backup requirements with Recovery Point Objective (RPO) and Recovery Time Objective (RTO) strategies—to ensure regulatory adherence and true system recoverability.
  2. Network delivery control: Network and perimeter controls should account for business continuity requirements and the latency challenges in distributed cloud environments. Different components of an application may run across geographically distant regions, impacting performance. When evaluating these factors, SAP published service-level agreements (SLAs) should be considered to get guidance on expected network performance and availability.
  3. Data Residency and Sovereignty: Organizations must ensure not only that their data is hosted in compliant regions, but also that backups and replicated environments adhere to the same regulatory and regional requirements.

Supplier Assessment

Life sciences organizations operating under GxP regulations must ensure quality, compliance, and control, even when using public cloud solutions. Under the shared responsibility model, certain application responsibilities are managed by SAP, while others remain with the life sciences organizations. However, the organizations themselves remain fully accountable to regulatory bodies for demonstrating compliance.

Due to the shared or deleted controls, organizations must qualify SAP as a supplier of GxP-relevant IT solutions. Customers may leverage the available information, questionnaires and 3rd party audit reports such as ISO 9001/27001 and SOC2. Additionally, customers may perform an on-site audit to help bridge gaps in understanding of SAP’s Quality Management System and other processes.

To facilitate on-site audits—such as with SAP Digital Manufacturing—customers can leverage the SAP Quality Requirement Schedule, which grants limited rights to perform an on-site audit and ensures support when life sciences organizations face regulatory audits.

Explore and Realize

GxP Strategy

Following product and supplier assessment, GxP strategy should be defined to ensure long term viability. Key elements of this strategy can include:

  1. Application Architecture: Evaluate which processes remain on-premises and which move to the cloud. Distributed manufacturing workflows spanning ERP (SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud) and MES (SAP Digital Manufacturing) require balancing data duplication, separation of responsibilities, ease of use, performance, and validation requirements.
  2. Extension: Extensions if required must undergo their own GxP evaluation and IQ/OQ/PQ. Consider the various API’s and dependencies utilized by the extensions and to adhere to clean core principals to ensure minimal PQ efforts over the extension lifecycle.

Partner selection

Many SAP customers leverage partners to accelerate adoption. Partners solutions are available through various marketplaces such as SAP Store, SAP Business Accelerator Hub and Qualified Partner Packages. For software partners, a supplier assessment is recommended to verify their Quality Management processes and that any integrated solution complies with GxP requirements.

Life sciences organizations also rely on implementation partners for consulting, deployment, and ongoing support activities. These partners should be evaluated on their ability to deliver in a GxP-regulated environment. Partner Blogs highlight nice capabilities, providing insight into compliant implementations.

Deploy and Run

Validation Strategy

Validation requirements for a public cloud are similar to on-premises, however these must be adapted to accommodate the fixed release schedule. Key practices that can assist :

  1. Risk Based on Scope and Usage: Leverage SAP’s existing documentation, such as Service Catalog, to define the validation scope based on business criticality and GxP impact. Organizations can exclude non-GxP functions to narrow down the scope of validation testing. Validation efforts should prioritize highly critical functionality, while lower critical functions may be tested through smoke test etc.

For regular release cycles the What’s New Viewer can be used to identify changes in functionality that require assessment on validation requirements. Not all new functionalities must be validated – with validation only necessary before the actual usage/adoption of the functionality.

  1. Automation: Automating Computer System Validation (CSV) reduces effort and helps ensure validation is completed on time. SAP Digital Manufacturing provides automation test modules compatible with Tricentis Test Automation (included in Enterprise Support). These automated tests can be leveraged for continuous testing and validation as part of a regression suite.
  2. Leveraging controls from SAP: GAMP5 recommends leveraging supplier testing (post supplier assessment) into verification. Organizations can inherit SAP’s controls based on the shared responsibility model around topics such as infrastructure, platform, security, data integrity etc.

Gen-AI

Generative AI can further reduce the compliance burden. By combining SAP’s structured documentation with a customer’s own documentation, it can generate automated, digitized risk assessments, documentation, and tests—significantly improving both the quality and speed of validation.

Conclusion

Maximizing SAP’s public cloud potential requires rethinking compliance controls. By adopting a risk-based approach and leveraging various tools provided by SAP, life sciences organizations can meet regulatory requirements while accelerating cloud adoption. This approach ensures compliance, fosters innovation, and builds trust in cloud-based operations.

entry.title: Re: Food for thought: What’s your favorite holiday/celebration dish?
entry.content:
Reading your story really made me smile because I can completely relate to how food connects us to people and memories. For me, cooking started out of curiosity too, I used to watch my grandmother make simple dishes, and I was always fascinated by how a few ingredients could bring everyone to the table.

During the pandemic, I also found myself spending more time in the kitchen. What surprised me most was how much joy it brought to share those dishes with family. I remember one weekend when I invited my cousins over, and instead of ordering in, we cooked together. Everyone got involved—one was chopping vegetables, another was mixing sauces, and the kids were shaping patties. It wasn’t perfect, but it was fun, and by the end we felt closer than ever.

That day also reminded me how much comfort food can bring, whether it’s a home-cooked meal or even something from outside that becomes part of your story. For example, I still remember the first time I tried Shake Shack with my friends after a long week—it wasn’t just about the burgers, but about the laughter, the conversations, and the shared moment.

Food really does have that magic: it nourishes the body, but it also feeds the heart. Thanks for inspiring me to think back on these moments. I’d love to keep seeing more of your dishes and stories, and maybe I’ll share some of my own experiments here too.

entry.title: Re: How to control PGI process between Sales and Supply C...
entry.content:
The ability to perform PGI (Post Goods Issue) in SAP Fiori hinges entirely on the authorization profile, specifically the Business Role and Business Catalog assignments.

So yes, if Sales users lack the catalog that includes the PGI functionality, they won’t be able to execute PGI—even if they can create deliveries. That’s by design: SAP’s role-based access ensures users only perform actions aligned with their responsibilities.

  • Who should have access to PGI?

Typically, PGI is granted to roles such as:

  • Warehouse Clerks or Shipping Specialists – who physically handle goods and confirm dispatch.

  • Logistics Execution Users – responsible for outbound processes.

  • Delivery Processing Roles – if PGI is part of their workflow.

These users would be assigned a Business Role that includes the Business Catalog containing the PGI app (e.g., "Outbound Delivery Processing" catalog). You can fine-tune access further using restriction values like shipping point, plant, or delivery type to ensure users only act on relevant data.

If you’re setting this up, make sure:

  • The correct Fiori app (e.g., Post Goods Issue for Outbound Delivery) is included in the catalog.

  • The catalog is assigned to the right Business Role.

  • The role is assigned to the appropriate Business User.

entry.title: Re: How to control PGI process between Sales and Supply C...
entry.content: To enable Post Goods Issue (PGI) functionality in SAP Fiori, you'll need to assign the correct Fiori app and Business Catalog to the relevant Business Role. Here's the precise info you need: 📦 SAP Fiori App for PGI App Name: Post Goods Issue for Outbound Delivery App ID: F1595 Semantic Object: OutboundDelivery Action: PostGoodsIssue This app allows users to post goods issue for outbound deliveries directly from the Fiori Launchpad. 📚 Business Catalog To enable this app, assign the following catalog: Catalog ID: SAP_SD_BC_OUTBOUND_DEL_PROC_MC Catalog Name: Outbound Delivery Processing This catalog includes the PGI app along with other outbound delivery-related apps like Change Outbound Delivery, Display Outbound Delivery, and Create Outbound Delivery. 👤 Who Should Get It? Assign this catalog to roles such as: Shipping Clerk Warehouse Operator Logistics Execution Specialist Sales users typically should not have this catalog unless they are directly involved in logistics execution. This ensures proper segregation of duties and avoids unauthorized PGI actions.

entry.title: Top 25 SAP S/4HANA & ABAP Interview Questions and Answers (2025)
entry.content:
Preparing for a SAP ABAP or S/4HANA interview can feel overwhelming. You spend hours revising concepts, yet when the interview starts, the real challenge is remembering which questions are most commonly asked and how to answer them with clarity.

To help you overcome this, I’ve compiled the Top 25 SAP ABAP and S/4HANA Interview Questions for 2025—based on real-world interview experiences and what hiring managers actually look for.

This post curates the most common SAP ABAP & S/4HANA interview questions for 2025—spanning DDIC, ALV, BDC, CDS, AMDP, Open vs Native SQL, ABAP on HANA, Web Dynpro and more. For clear, step-by-step answers, watch the full breakdown here:
👉 Video: Top 25 SAP S/4HANA & ABAP Interview Questions and Answers (2025)

📌 Top 25 SAP ABAP & S/4HANA Interview Questions (2025)

  1. What is SAP ABAP?
  2. What is the ABAP Data Dictionary (DDIC)?
  3. Difference between transparent tables and pooled/cluster tables
  4. What are SmartForms and their benefits over SAP Scripts?
  5. Difference between function modules and BAPIs
  6. What is BDC (Batch Data Communication)? Methods: recording, session, call transaction
  7. What are modularization techniques in ABAP?
  8. Difference between Classical Reports, Interactive Reports, and ALV Reports
  9. What are field symbols and how are they used?
  10. How do you define and use internal tables?
  11. What are the basic data types in ABAP?
  12. What is ABAP Objects (OOP in ABAP)?
  13. Explain inheritance and polymorphism in ABAP Objects
  14. What is a Lock Object? How is locking handled in ABAP?
  15. Open SQL vs Native SQL – differences and use cases
  16. What are RICEFW objects in SAP projects?
  17. Explain CALL TRANSACTION and its use cases
  18. What are CDS Views and their significance in S/4HANA?
  19. What is AMDP (ABAP Managed Database Procedure) and why is it used?
  20. Debugging in ABAP – breakpoints, watchpoints, ST22 dumps
  21. What is Web Dynpro for ABAP?
  22. CDS vs AMDP vs Traditional Reports – when to use which?
  23. What are the key features of ABAP on HANA?
  24. What tools and T-codes are essential for ABAP development?
  25. What are type groups and their purpose in ABAP?

Why this matters in 2025 (How to Crack SAP ABAP Interview)

SAP technology continues to evolve, especially with ABAP on HANA and S/4HANA migrations. Interviewers are no longer just testing textbook knowledge—they want to see if you can connect concepts to real project scenarios. These 25 questions cover exactly that mix of fundamentals + modern ABAP practices.

📽️ For in-depth answers, examples, and explanations, check out the full video:
👉 Top 25 SAP ABAP & S/4HANA Interview Questions and Answers (2025)

💡 Tip: Don’t just memorize these questions—try to explain them in your own words, link them to project experience, and always be ready with a short example. That’s what makes you stand out in interviews.

entry.title: Re: cannot find AI Core service in BTP trail account
entry.content:
👉 In short, Trial = no AI Core. Free Tier / PAYG = AI Core.

You won’t find SAP AI Core in a BTP trial account, as it isn’t part of the trial entitlements. To use it, you’ll need to switch to a Free Tier (Pay-As-You-Go or Enterprise) account and then add the entitlement in your global account.

If you just want to learn, I recommend checking out the official SAP AI Core Starter Tutorials

entry.title: how do I send a request to the SPA workflow from Custom fiori app?
entry.content:
Hi all,
 I'm having an issue with the SAP build process automation.  I created a simple workflow structure and deployed. After, I tested whether  the workflow service on the api.sap site and Postman.   The workflow is working and successfully ı see task in myinbox. 
But when ı try to request from my  custom fiori it gives error.  When I adapt the request in the post, I get a cors error.  So  I thought I definitely needed to send a request through the destination, so I created a destination from the service instance. 
my destination :


After  I described this destinationin xs.app.json file like that

      {
      "source": "^/spalast/(.*)$",
      "target": "/public/workflow/rest/v1/$1",

entry.title: Re: In the SAP Public Cloud MTO (Make-to-Order) process,...
entry.content:
For information, in Public Cloud, CBTA is the standard item category for MTO (Make‑to‑Order) with item category group CB04. CBTA in the delivered scope items is usually set up for order‑related billing (billing relevance “I” – billing plan) rather than delivery‑related billing. Because of that, there is no standard copying control entry from delivery type LF / item category CBTA to billing type F2; the system doesn’t expect you to bill from the delivery for this process. Hence, F2 is not being created in your case.

SAP Note 3269803 referred here, is a configuration content note that delivers missing copying control entries for certain item categories in S/4HANA Cloud. If your tenant is missing the LF → F2 copying control for CBTA and you want to enable delivery‑related billing for it, this note is relevant, but, in Public Cloud, you cannot directly maintain VTFL/VTFA; you need to use the corresponding SSCUI or request SAP to adjust via Expert Configuration. The note itself won’t “switch” CBTA from order‑related to delivery‑related billing, but you’d also need to adjust the billing relevance in the item category and align the schedule line category.

If you want delivery‑related billing for MTO, CBTA’s billing relevance must be changed from “I” to “B”. This is a scope/process change and hence, check if it aligns with your business requirement.

entry.title: Re: S4 Public Cloud 0L vs 4G configuration
entry.content:
Hello @JuliaLu

Yes, that is correct. If the customer requires Universal Parallel Accounting, then the Ledger 4G must be used. The partner should explain to the customer why 4G is required and that all process will follow the advance valuation framework.

If there is no requirement for Universal Parallel Accounting, then 4G should not be activated. Which means that in that case OL remains the leading ledger and all valuation will run against it.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Restricting User-Level Read and Delete Access - Datas...
entry.content:
Hi, I think that the question is more business user oriented. Not developer.

In DSP the DACs control data, but not objects. Only views support DACs anyway, so you cannot add DACs to a table at all. You also cannot allow/disallow access to specific objects to specific users. This is done space-wide. 

If uploading data into DSP via CSV, you assume a developer is uploading, not a business user. So a developer has full access to the table. 

Separated space for each Conso Unit would be the best approach. Another way would be to create a separate Space for CSVs, then for each Conso Unit one table, however this will not restrict the users to see 'other' tables if the want. 

Maybe the best way is to pre-stage the upload into SharePoint. Create an SFTP Connection from DSP to FTP server and upload the files automatically every night via task chain. 

Martin

entry.title: Re: Why no Delete options for Comments, Answers, Posts, Q...
entry.content:
Hi @Sijin_Chandran - this is mainly due to EU's Digital Services Act as @Dominik_Tylczynski also mentions. 

To stay DSA compliant, we need to always create a DSA case when content is deleted, and inform the author of why the content was deleted. Delete permissions are complex (even on the old platform you were only allowed to delete content as long as it had no children, ie. no comments or answers). To ensure DSA compliance, the delete persmissions were therefore restricted to the SAP Community team moderators last year when DSA went into effect. 

Having said that, we are continously reviewing options and evaluating our moderation practices within all the different regulations that are being introduced globally currently. (other than DSA in the EU, we now also have similar regulations either already in place, or emerging, in the UK, Australia, New Zealand, Singapore, Vietnam, China, India, South Korea, Japan, Brazil and California)

entry.title: 关于拓展S/4HANA你所需要知道的一切
entry.content:
本文内容来自 SAP S/4HANA Extensibility: All You Need to Know ，目的是帮助您理解如何拓展S/4 HANA

这篇博客 文章是SAP S/4HANA扩展性相关资料链接的集合，按主题分组。

这篇博客文章分为6个部分：

  • 1. 获取扩展性概念的概述
  • 2. 关键用户扩展性
  • 3. 开发人员扩展性（又称SAP S/4HANA Cloud ABAP环境或"嵌入式Steampunk"）
  • 4. 经典扩展性
  • 5. SAP BTP，ABAP环境（又称"Steampunk"）
  • 6. SAP BTP：其他环境

这篇博客文章于2022年10月完全重写，以反映开发人员扩展性（"SAP S/4HANA Cloud，ABAP环境"或"嵌入式Steampunk"）的发布。2023年6月我添加了"ABAP Cloud"的内容。2024年，我更改了博客的标题（我去掉了"学习旅程"这个术语，因为这是SAP官方学习资料使用的），并包含了SAP Build和SAP Build Code等主题。

作为一个小声明，我想指出，这篇博客文章专注于基于ABAP的扩展性选项。这是因为ABAP在我的舒适区内，我想把SAP BTP上其他扩展性选项的主题留给这个领域的专家。 请注意，这是特定文档和资源链接的集合。请不要在本文档的评论部分提问，而是参考具体的文档或社区，在那里询问关于特定扩展任务和工具的问题！

1. 获取扩展性概念的概述

作为第一步，获得对SAP S/4HANA扩展性概念的基本了解。

扩展性概念的基本构建模块是：

  • "体内"扩展性，使用：
    • 关键用户扩展性工具
    • 开发人员扩展性（又称SAP S/4HANA Cloud，ABAP环境或"嵌入式Steampunk"，随SAP S/4HANA Cloud 2208和SAP S/4HANA 2022引入）
    • 经典扩展性（又称经典ABAP自定义开发）
  • 使用SAP BTP的并行扩展性：
    • 使用SAP Build在SAP BTP上创建的低代码扩展
    • 使用SAP Build Code在SAP BTP上开发的扩展，使用SAP BTP环境和服务，如Java或Node.JS
    • SAP BTP ABAP环境

为了理解扩展性概念，我推荐：

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud的干净核心扩展性（2024）
  • 专注于ABAP的白皮书《使用基于ABAP的扩展在云端和本地扩展SAP S/4HANA》（2024年更新）

白皮书还包括何时使用哪种扩展性选项的建议。

ABAP Cloud是构建云就绪业务应用程序、服务和扩展的ABAP开发模型。它涵盖了SAP BTP和SAP S/4HANA的开发者和关键用户扩展性，适用于公有云、私有云和本地部署。

要了解ABAP Cloud，请阅读我同事的博客，即《ABAP Cloud》和《ABAP Cloud – 它包含什么？》作为起点。

SAP应用程序扩展方法论提供了评估客户扩展用例和以结构化、正式化方式定义扩展目标解决方案的方法论。它为客户和合作伙伴提供了结构化、技术无关的方法来定义组织特定的扩展策略。它涵盖了"干净核心"、"云就绪性"和"面向未来"等挑战。

知识来源： 在以下部分中，我提供了来自这些知识来源的特定文档的其他链接：

  • Communities:
    • ABAP Development:  ABAP Development | SAP Community
    • ABAP Extensibility: ABAP Extensibility | SAP Community
    • Embedded Steampunk and 3-Tier: SAP S/4HANA Cloud ABAP Environment | SAP Community
  • SAP S/4HANA Extensibility Explorer: SAP Extensibility Explorer 
  • Leaning Journeys: Learning Journeys - Overview (sap.com)
  • Tutorials: https://developers.sap.com/tutorial-navigator.html
  • Product Documentation: SAP S/4HANA Cloud | SAP Help Portal ; SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition | SAP Help Portal, SAP S/4HANA | SAP Help Portal
  • SAP Activate for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition  (Filter: Workstreams – Extensibility)
  • SAP Business Accelerator Hub: SAP Business Accelerator Hub
  • Latest TechEd Sessions:
    • DT201 | Extensibility for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
    • DT200 | Clean Core extensibility in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 

 

2. 关键用户扩展性

关键用户扩展性工具是SAP S/4HANA扩展性概念的主要支柱。它们是为云设计的，但也在本地/私有云版本中提供。

关键用户扩展性可用于：

• SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

• SAP S/4HANA（本地）和SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition及扩展版

（注：为简便起见，我将SAP S/4HANA（本地）和SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition简写为SAP S/4HANA OP/PCE）

2.1 获取概述

在我的博客中，我介绍了关键用户扩展性工具： 

  • The Key User Extensibility Tools of S/4 HANA
  • Extensibility - ABAP Platform
  • S/4HANA Extensibility: Use Case Overview
  • S/4HANA Extensibility Concept Details: Restricted ABAP
  • TechEd 2024: 🟢 What Software Developers Should Know About Key ... - SAP Community

如果您想了解关键用户，我建议阅读我同事的博客 SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA – What is Key User Extensibility and Who are your Key Users and Introduction to S/4HANA Cloud and SAP S/4HANA On-Premise Key-User Extensibility . 

2.2 预告视频

放松一下，您可能会喜欢一些视频来获得扩展性外观和感觉的视觉印象：

  • Video: Journey of Managing Sales Orders in SAP Fiori: #4 Key User Adaptation
  • Video: Journey of Managing Sales Orders in SAP Fiori: #5 Extensibility and Custom Fields
  • Video: Extending Fixed Assets Master Data in SAP S/4HANA Cloud
  • Video: Creating Custom Fields
  • Video: Custom Business Objects (Creating Custom Applications, Implementing Business Logic)
  • Video: Creating Custom CDS Views as External APIs, Exposing Custom CDS Views as External APIs,  
  • Video: Creating Custom Analytical Queries

2.3 在教科书或培训中整合所有内容

Schneider, Thomas; Wolf, Werner: Erweiterungen für SAP S/4HANA（德语）SAP PRESS 2018（德语）。

2.4 文档

在开始开发之前，查看文档可能会有帮助（注：文档的语言和版本可在屏幕右上角选择）：

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition中的关键用户扩展性工具： https://help.sap.com/viewer/p/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD -> Product Assistance -> English -> Extend and Integrate Your SAP S/4HANA Cloud -> Extensibility -> Key User Extensibility
  • SAP S/4HANA（OP/PCE）中的关键用户扩展性工具：  https://help.sap.com/viewer/p/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE -> Product Assistance -> English -> Enterprise Technology -> ABAP Platform (or SAP Netweaver in older releases) -> Developing on the ABAP Platform -> Development Concepts and Tools -> Extensibility -> Key User Extensibility
  • 关键用户的UI适配工具：
    • Adapting SAP Fiori UIs at Runtime - Key User Adaptation - SAP Help Portal
    • Getting Started with UI Adaptations for Classic Applications in SAP S/4HANA Cloud
  • Fiori扩展性文档：扩展性 – SAP Library
  • 在Fiori应用库（Fiori Apps Library）中，您可以找到Fiori应用的扩展性信息。打开Fiori应用的应用详细信息，转到实施信息、扩展性部分。

2.5 动手实践：教程、最佳实践、操作指南

现在，您想要创建一些应用内扩展。

示例场景：SAP S/4HANA Cloud的SAP扩展性资源管理器显示了许多由应用专家编写的真实示例场景（用于应用内扩展性和并行扩展性）。

自定义业务对象和自定义UI 

  • Create Custom Business Objects in S/4HANA Cloud
  • Create a Custom UI for SAP S/4HANA Cloud | Tutorials for SAP Developers
  • Extend Custom Business Object with Business Rules in S/4HANA Cloud
  • Usage of OData Service of Custom Business Object

2.6 了解本地/PCE和公有云之间的差异

如前所述，关键用户扩展性工具是为云设计的，但也在OP/PCE版本中提供。但是，公有云和OP/PCE之间存在一些差异：

  • 不同的UI/OData（Gateway）设置（嵌入式与中心场景）
  • 不同的身份和访问管理（IAM）和通信管理设置
  • 不同的传输设置（在开发、测试和生产系统之间）

因此，关键用户工具在某些领域工作方式不同（例如在OData发布和UI中）或在OP/PCE中完全不可用（关键用户工具IAM/COM）。请参考公有云和OP/PCE的文档。对于自定义业务对象的UI创建，请参考以下文章：为自定义业务对象创建自定义SAP Fiori应用 和SAP note 3458562 - CBO本地UI生成的向下移植。

 

3. 开发者扩展性

开发者扩展性（又称SAP S/4HANA Cloud，ABAP环境或"嵌入式Steampunk"）随SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2208和SAP S/4HANA（OP/PCE）2022引入。

  • SAP S/4HANA（OP/PCE）中的开发者扩展性工具： https://help.sap.com/viewer/p/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE -> Product Assistance -> English -> Enterprise Technology -> ABAP Platform (or SAP Netweaver in older releases) -> Developing on the ABAP Platform -> Development Concepts and Tools -> Extensibility -> Developer Extensibility

3.5 了解本地/PCE和公有云之间的差异

公有云和本地/PCE之间的主要区别是：在公有云中ABAP Cloud是强制性的，经典扩展性不可用。

但是，公有云和OP/PCE之间还有一些其他差异：

  • 不同的UI/OData（Gateway）设置（嵌入式与中心场景）
  • 不同的身份和访问管理（IAM）和通信管理设置
  • 不同的传输设置（在开发、测试和生产系统之间）

因此，工具在某些领域工作方式不同（例如在OData发布和UI中）或在OP/PCE中完全不可用（例如Cloud IAM/COM的ADT编辑器）。请参考公有云和OP/PCE的文档。

 

4. 经典扩展性和3层模型

经典扩展性（又称经典ABAP自定义开发）在SAP S/4HANA（OP/PCE）中可用。它指的是SAP的经典自定义ABAP开发模型，您作为客户或合作伙伴可以使用它来扩展基于ABAP的本地SAP解决方案。

  • SAP S/4HANA（OP/PCE）中的经典扩展性工具：https://help.sap.com/viewer/p/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE -> Product Assistance -> English -> Enterprise Technology -> ABAP Platform (or SAP Netweaver in older releases) -> Developing on the ABAP Platform -> Development Concepts and Tools -> Extensibility -> Classic Extensibility
  • SAP Community Network，ABAP扩展性主题页面是ABAP扩展性相关主题的登陆页面。

3层模型

3层模型是将现代ABAP Cloud开发引入SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition和SAP S/4HANA的方式。它允许您区分遵循云扩展性模型的扩展（第1层）、作为云API启用层的第2层，以及包含使用经典扩展性技术的现有自定义代码或遗留开发的第3层。

  • ABAP Cloud – How to mitigate missing released SAP APIs in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, private edition and SAP...

5. 使用SAP BTP ABAP环境的并行扩展性

entry.title: How to collaborate on an entity of a draft enabled RAP Business Object ?
entry.content:
Introduction

With the latest release 2508 of SAP BTP ABAP Environment a new feature called Collaborative Draft has been delivered.  This feature allows that several users can work on the same draft instance of an entity of a RAP Business Object. 

So similar like collaborating on a file in Microsoft Teams it is now possible that several users can perform changes on an entity of a RAP Business Object at the same time.

The cool thing is that every draft enabled RAP BO can be enhanced so that it also supports Collaborative Draft without the need to change the existing ABAP code of your behavior implementation class(es). It is only required to change a few lines of code in the behavior definition, the behavior projection and you have to create a draft query view  which projects all fields of the draft table. of the "authorization master" entity which in most cases this is the root entity of your business object.

In case your active business object view entity is protected by a DCL (which is strongly recommended for every productive RAP business object 😉)  the draft query view must also be protected by a data control language (DCL).

Please note:  
As described in the section Outlook the implementation will become even easier in the future once table entities will be supported as a draft persistency.   

Prerequisites

  1. You need a draft enabled RAP Business object (which you can easily generate using the new "from scratch generator").
  2.  Your user and any other user that is supposed to use / test your RAP BO must have the new business catalog  SAP_CORE_BC_RAP_DRAFT_PC assigned which is part of the business role template
    SAP_BR_EMPLOYEE. 
    You have hence first to ask your administrator to either generate an additional role based on the role template SAP_BR_EMPLOYEE or let the administrator assign the business catalogue to an existing role which is assigned to developers on your SAP BTP ABAP Environment system, so that you and your colleagues can start developing and testing this cool new feature.

Result

In the following you see me (Andre Fischer) and the user ANZEIGER working on the same instance of a draft entity. As soon as a user leaves the focus of a field the changes will be updated automatically in the UI of the other user.

You can test the collaborative draft setup even in systems where you have just one user, like in our trial systems.

In the first screen shot I am editing the field "Notes" (highlighted in red) and I can see that I am editing the field "OrderID" in the second tab (highlighted in green).

In the second screen shot we see vice versa that I am there editing the field "OrderID" (highlighted in red) and that I am editing the field notes in the other session in the first tab.

Implementation Steps

A step by step guide which describe how to enhance an existing draft enabled RAP Business Object has been provided for your convenience to the SAP Online Help.

An example of a RAP Business Object has also been delievered as part of the well known Flight Reference Sample with the latest version in Github which now contains an additional sub package /DMO/FLIGHT_COLLDRAFT.

Implementation Walkthrough

I will add a few screen shots on how I have enabled my small RAP BO using the above mentioned documentation. As shown in the following screen shot only the behavior definition and the behavior projection have to be changed and two additional objects, the draft query view for the draft table of the root entity and the DCL for the draft query view have to be created.

1. Changes in the behavior Definition

As described in the documentation the we have specify in the behavior definition that collaborative draft is used instead of exclusive draft and for the root entity we have to add the use of the draft query view for the draft table and we have to add the action Share.

2. Changes in the behavior projection

In the behavior projection we simply have to add use statements so that the collaborative draft is used for our RAP business object and we have to enable the action Share.

3. Create new object - Draft Query View

4. Create DCL for the Draft Query View

Outlook

In future releases, when table entities will be supported to store the draft data it will not be necessary anymore to create a draft query view for the draft table. This is because in this case the table entity can be directly secured by a DCL.

The setup shown in this blog post will be presented in upcoming events such as the sitBE Event in Mechelen, the DevToberFest and naturally TechEd and TechConnect events later this year.

DevToberFest Sample

And you can find the code of the sample application which shows a Shopping Cart with a header and a child entity for items that I will use in this blog post soon in Github as well. 

For the implementation I used the "from scratch generator" and as a template for the root entity I used the following structure

@EndUserText.label : 'Shopping Cart Header Data'
@AbapCatalog.enhancement.category : #NOT_EXTENSIBLE
define structure zdmo_cart_## {

  currency                : abap.cuky;
  notes                   : abap.char(100);
  order_id                : abap.numc(8);
  requested_delivery_date : fins_caldate;
  @Semantics.amount.currencyCode : 'zdmo_cart_##.currency'
  total_price             : abap.curr(11,2);

}

while for the child entity this structure was used

@EndUserText.label : 'Shopping Cart Item Data'
@AbapCatalog.enhancement.category : #NOT_EXTENSIBLE
define structure zdmo_item_## {

  item_id         : abap.numc(8);
  ordered_item    : matnr40;
  quantity        : abap.numc(4);
  currency        : abap.cuky;
  @Semantics.amount.currencyCode : 'zdmo_item_##.currency'
  item_price      : abap.curr(11,2);
  @Semantics.amount.currencyCode : 'zdmo_item_##.currency'
  item_unit_price : abap.curr(11,2);

}

entry.title: Re: The delivery date in the schedule line of the sales o...
entry.content:
The system calculates the confirmed delivery date in the schedule line by running delivery scheduling and transportation scheduling. The calculation uses:

  • Shipping point lead times (picking/packing time, loading time)
  • Route transit time (if a route is determined)
  • Transportation lead time
  • Factory calendar for the plant and shipping point

If plant 5002 is new, it’s very likely that:

  • The shipping point assigned to plant 5002 has default lead times (e.g., 2 days picking + 2 days loading), or
  • The route determination for plant 5002 → customer is assigning a route with a transit time of 4 days, or
  • The factory calendar for plant 5002 has non‑working days between 13.09.2025 and 17.09.2025, which pushes the first possible goods issue date forward.

That’s why you see a 4‑day gap for plant 5002, but not for other plants.

entry.title: Re: IDoc 0000000000075134 and determined transport type E...
entry.content: The error "IDoc and determined transport type EXTPAY do not match" (IHC_IDOC639) occurs because the system cannot correctly determine that your payment is an external payment. The most common root cause is missing SWIFT/BIC code in the master data of the external vendor's bank. The system uses this code to distinguish between internal (TRANSF) and external (EXTPAY) payments.

entry.title: TM PPF Output Management for Business Partners (partner dependent action)
entry.content:
We use S/4HANA 2023 FPS02 and I have a TM related questions. We are in the shipper scenario.

We defined the freight order output (the PDF which we send to our carrier for the transport service) as action. It works.

We recognized that we can set an action as partner-dependent. This makes sense, because we want to send the freight order only to our carriers.

We set our action for the freight order as "Partner dependent". The action is only relevant for U3 Carrier.

Now it does not work any more.

The output configuration guide Output Management Configuration Guide says that you need to redefine  GET_COMM_PARNR_BY_ABAP to get the partners. OK, wired enough that you need to code such a basic requirement, but we did it.

 

The action is now determined ✅ in the FO, but the execution fails, because the system does not determine the default communication method (E-Mail, Print), language,... everything what was "standard" in NAST. We assume that's the issue.

The help documentation Output Management for Business Partners | SAP Help Portal explains that there is an Output Management area in the Business Partner (BP). We configured all data sets, screen groups and screens, included everything in the BP role....but, we cannot find the "Output Management" fields in the BP transaction. We assume, there you can define required information for the action. Are we wrong? Is this Output Management tab part of S/4 or only a relict of old TM?

Does anyone have a few more information for us how we can achieve to get the carrier communcation details automatically into the FO? Before we start with redefinition of many methods in the PPF "toolbox" we were wondering if there is any out of the box logic to send an email to the carrier.

Thank you

entry.title: Consulta sobre cambio de RUC, licencias y soporte en SAP Business One (Perú)
entry.content:
Buen día a todos,

Tengo varias dudas sobre el funcionamiento y licenciamiento de SAP Business One en el contexto peruano, tanto a nivel contable como contractual.

  1. Cambio de RUC y razón social Si adquiero SAP Business One registrado con una razón social y un RUC específicos (Registro Único de Contribuyente), ¿qué sucede si posteriormente doy de baja ese RUC y esa razón social? ¿Es posible migrar toda la información y licencias a una nueva razón social y RUC, manteniendo el mismo propietario legal?

  2. Soporte y mantenimiento Dejé de pagar el soporte y mantenimiento de SAP por casi 5 años. Cuando intenté regularizar la situación con mi partner, me indicaron que estaba sujeto a un contrato “de por vida”, a pesar de no haber usado el sistema en los últimos 2 años. ¿Existe alguna forma de recuperar las licencias y poder reinstalar/migrar el sistema, considerando que debo cambiar de hardware por daño del equipo?

  3. Licencias como activos Tengo entendido que las licencias de SAP se consideran activos. ¿Es posible venderlas, transferirlas o trasladarlas a otra empresa o persona?

Agradezco mucho cualquier orientación, experiencia o referencia normativa que puedan compartir, especialmente si han pasado por un caso similar en Perú.

Saludos, Marko

entry.title: Re: TM PPF Output Management for Business Partners (partn...
entry.content: @Ronald_Knienieder The issue is not a bug but a fundamental architectural difference. In the old NAST world, output parameters were stored statically in the Business Partner (BP) master data. In the new PPF world, these parameters must be determined dynamically at runtime by redefining specific methods in the PPF agent class. The "Output Management" tab in the BP is a relic of the NAST era and is not used by TM's PPF output management in S/4HANA.The solution is to enhance the standard PPF agent class for the Freight Order business object to provide the missing communication data (method, address, language) by reading it from the correct parts of the BP master data.

entry.title: Re: TM PPF Output Management for Business Partners (partn...
entry.content:
The Output Management tab in the Business Partner was not part of NAST. For NAST, I defined in condition records how the partner shall receive the output (channel, language). I don't see this as "oldfashioned" 😉

Thanks of course for your reply. I hope there is still some other feedback that we can easily determine the output channel w/o ABAP. I mean, it's a standard solution and using classes/methods/Badis....not really sure if this is the way to go for a really basic requirement.

entry.title: Re: What is the best approach in SAP ECC to transfer asse...
entry.content: @Gourav_Deshmukh The optimal and standard SAP-recommended approach is to use the automated intercompany asset transfer transaction (ABT1N). You do not need to align or deactivate areas 70 and 71 in the receiving company code. Instead, you will leverage SAP's Cross-System Depreciation Areas configuration to explicitly define which areas transfer their values. By leaving areas 70 and 71 unassigned in this configuration, they will be seamlessly excluded from the transfer process.Attempting to manually retire and acquire the asset is error-prone, misses automatic reconciliation features, and is not best practice for this scenario

entry.title: Re: TM PPF Output Management for Business Partners (partn...
entry.content: You are right, the old way was not "old-fashioned" it was a different, highly effective architecture.The classic NAST (Message Control) framework did not rely on the BP's Output Management tab for default values. Its power and flexibility came from the condition technique

entry.title: 🚀 What happens when FI, Logistics and Business One experts sit at one table?
entry.content:
A lot of laughter, some tough questions, and plenty of real project stories.

Last night’s SAP Stammtisch showed once again:
👉 We don’t just talk about systems – we share experiences, pain points and solutions.

Special thanks to Sabine Clemens for your sharp insights into the FI world – with your depth and energy, any FI project can fly.
Big shout-out to our colleagues from Limassol Maxim Kulakov and Nizam Babayev for opening the B1 perspective – great to learn from you and understand your processes.
And of course, thanks to Damla Toraman for making the evening smooth, fun, and interactive.

This is exactly why I love these sessions: we learn from each other, across modules, across backgrounds.

💡 Who’s in for the next round?

entry.title: 🌴 Cyprus, curiosity and community – our SAP Stammtisch recap
entry.content:
When the sun sets over Cyprus and consultants from FI, Logistics, and Business One gather at one table, you can feel it right away: something’s happening here.

The atmosphere was electric – everyone curious, a little excited, and wondering what this Stammtisch would bring. It wasn’t about slides or theory. It was about people meeting people. About sharing the stories behind the systems.

Colleagues even traveled in from faraway cities, proof that the word spread across multiple channels and that this community is hungry for exchange.

And what did we dive into?
💡 How financial integration really plays out in daily projects
💡 The effort and hidden challenges of migrating to S/4
💡 The perspective from Business One and what we can learn from it
💡 How logistics processes in S/4 look and feel in practice

The highlight? Live demos straight from a test system – showing not just the theory, but the reality of how S/4 behaves. That’s where the room lit up with questions, ideas, and debates.

We closed the evening the way it started: relaxed, open, and full of curiosity for what comes next.
Because that’s the magic of a Stammtisch in Cyprus – it’s not just about SAP. It’s about connections, curiosity, and community.

🚀 Who’s joining us for the next round?

entry.title: Re: Unable to Create WT for Returns Delivery, item shows...
entry.content:
Dear @Lakshmi_Priya96,

the stock type in your warehouse has nothing to do with the stock type of your delivery.

The stock type of the delivery in your case most likely comes from the returns purchase order item. Could you please check the item in the 'Purchase Order - Advanced' app in the tab 'Delivery'? There you see the stock type for the item from where it should be picked.

You can also check the LE Delivery item on the administration tab.

This stock type is taken over to the warehouse delivery.

In order to correct that you need to reverse your existing delivery. Afterwards you can correct the stock type of the purchase order item and create a new delivery.

 

best regards, Marius

entry.title: Re: SAP Enable Now - Bulk Function (bubble, font style) t...
entry.content:
Tools - Replace Bubble Styles. This will mass replace bubble styles in sims. 

As for the book pages, you can do the following: 

DISCLAIMER: for experienced users only. If you break your local workspace, I won't feel guilty at all 😁.

    1. Open the book page's slide.js or slide.xml file and locate the technical ID of the legacy bubble style. e.g. "big_title_bar_light_theme"
    2. Find the ID of the bubble style you want to use as a replacement. I won't explain how, because if you can't find it, you shouldn't proceed to the next steps.
    3. Start editing all the book pages.
    4. Using Notepad++, run the command Find in Files
    5. Replace all the occurrences of the legacy bubble style in the files slide.xml, slide.js with the new bubble style in the <path to your workspace>/slide folder

  1. Return to Producer, and select Workspace - Refresh Workspace ad All Objects
  2. Save your changes to the server.
  3. Enjoy.

entry.title: Re: Automatic Sales order exctraction
entry.content:
Hello @SKAE 

Thank you for your question.

Based on your screenshots and the error message, it seems the scope is fine.

To resolve the issue, first, you need to activate communication scenario SAP_COM_1129 in your communication arrangement app. This should point to the document information extraction service instance. Make sure the user creating the communication arrangement has the correct communication management role.

Then you need to make sure the document extractions service instance is available in your BTP subaccount. Make sure you create a service key for the instance.

Once you have activated and connected SAP_COM_1129, re-run the prerequisite check in the intelligent scenario management. The connection error should no longer be visible and you will be able to activate the deployment.

Consult the following references for more details.

KBA 3452093

Communication Scenarios

Document Processing and Information Extraction

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris
